Scenario: Test active alerts endpoint with all valid parameters
Given: Given I have valid status, message_type, and event parameters
When: When I send a GET request to "/alerts/active" with parameters
Then: Then I should receive a 200 OK response
All Steps: Given I have valid status, message_type, and event parameters | When I send a GET request to "/alerts/active" with parameters | Then I should receive a 200 OK response

Scenario: Test active alerts endpoint with invalid parameters
Given: Given I have invalid status, message_type, and event parameters
When: When I send a GET request to "/alerts/active" with parameters
Then: Then I should receive a 400 Bad Request response
All Steps: Given I have invalid status, message_type, and event parameters | When I send a GET request to "/alerts/active" with parameters | Then I should receive a 400 Bad Request response

When: When I send a GET request to "/alerts/active/count"
Then: Then I should receive a 200 OK response | And The response should contain an integer for total, land, and marine alerts
All Steps: Given I have no parameters | When I send a GET request to "/alerts/active/count" | Then I should receive a 200 OK response | And The response should contain an integer for total, land, and marine alerts

Scenario: Test specific alert endpoint with valid id
Given: Given I have a valid alert id

Scenario: Test specific alert endpoint with invalid id

All Steps: Given I have an invalid alert id | When I send a GET request to "/alerts/{id}" with id "invalid" | Then I should receive a 404 Not Found response
